meanings.definition: The state of being uncertain or unstable.
meanings.sent1: The precariousnesses of the old bridge made me nervous to cross it.
meanings.sent2: The hiker felt the precariousnesses of the narrow mountain trail beneath his feet.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's balancing act on the tree branch highlighted the precariousnesses of its situation.
meanings.sent4: The fragile glass sculptures symbolized the precariousnesses of life's beauty.
meanings.sent5: The flickering candle flame represented the precariousnesses of existence.

meanings.definition: The quality of being risky or dangerous.
meanings.sent1: The precariousnesses of the situation required careful planning.
meanings.sent2: The explorer faced the precariousnesses of the uncharted jungle with bravery.
meanings.sent3: The clown's juggling act added an element of precariousnesses to the circus performance.
meanings.sent4: The tightrope walker embodied the precariousnesses of balancing between success and failure.
meanings.sent5: The stormy seas reflected the precariousnesses of maritime adventures.
